revised_title: Artificial Production of Echinoderm Larvae with Dual Water-Vascular Systems
tldr: The author conducted experiments to understand the development of echinoderm larvae and discovered that by artificially inducing the formation of two hydrocoeles, the bilateral symmetry of the larva can be retained, and the subsequent development profoundly modified. This was achieved by rearing the larvae of Echinus miliaris under controlled conditions and observing the effects of environmental factors on their development.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
